text:
@brett_mearkle @HowtoADHD Neurodiversity is an umbrella term for mental illness, learning disability, and developmental disabilities - all the different ways brains can be different. 

It intersects with but is different from race issues.

@brett_mearkle @ischemgeek I'm sorry this doesn't fit with your world view. I didn't want to believe it either. But it's there, it exists, and I can't pretend it doesn't. I can't ask people to understand and respect my neurodiversity challenges if I'm not willing to understand their diversity challenges.

text: @kirstycrinson @AnnMemmott @SueReviews @Noahsasson Not really what? You're literally repeating what I said. Neurotypical are not neurodivergent (obviously). They are, however, part of neurodiversity. Diversity is *all* of the variation - the common and the uncommon, the typical and the atypical.

We live in CA, where Gov. @GavinNewsom just mandated face masks. Which I support! However, some autistic people, like my son, can‚Äôt tolerate face masks at all. Here‚Äôs how we‚Äôre managing, with ideas for accommodations, at @WashingtonPost:

https://t.co/ZXuUvh5tow #Neurodiversity

text: @kirstycrinson @AnnMemmott @SueReviews @Noahsasson Neurodiversity includes typical as well as neurodivergent (atypical). Neurodivergent includes neurodevelopmental conditions like autism and dyspraxia, but also also dementia, brain tumours, hydrocephalus, etc..

@kirstycrinson @AnnMemmott @SueReviews @Noahsasson Diversity is the way organisms differ from one another. Neurodiversity (a cultural, not medical, term) refers to the way human brains differ from one another. Literally ever single person is part of nurodiversity, i.e. the neurological diversity of the human species.

How do you unplug your brain?

#Neurodiversity #mentalhealth
